about_the_game:
The world's greatest indoor game goes to outer-space!

In the year 2629, three years after the evil Chuslibs' defeat on New Earth, Lieutenant Jerry J. Jensen is taking his girlfriend Cisco to play pool at the ritzy Asta-Pool Club, a billiards joint near his star-base. Little does Jerry know about the explosive asta-night that awaits him as he battles to prove whether humans can still beat bots in the 27th Century.

In space, pool is played on large, steel tables outside your window where balls float effortlessly. Many new, exciting games have been invented since the humble, green-felt tables of centuries past, but both the old and new games are cherished by asta-noobs and hustlers alike!

Asta-Pool is:
* Perfect for humans who have never played pool before! (You are shown how to play.)
* Over 25 different games and 40 levels of fun, humor, and extras.
* Completely family-friendly.
* Different than any pool game you have ever experienced!

You can:
* Play relaxing turn-based classics like 8-ball and 9-ball.
* Play fast-paced games like Scramble and Asta-Ball.
* Play other NEW games invented long after you die!
* Learn basic pool terms and techniques.
* Learn fancy moves like bank-shots, kick-shots, and combinations!
* Discover The Asta-Pool Club's sinister secret.
* Take "The Sharkbot Challenge."
* Become a better pool-player!
* Play the person sitting next to you (with additional pc-compatible controller).

highlighted.name: You passed all levels of Infectaball!

name: ASTA-POOL: Can humans beat bots?

package_groups.name: default
package_groups.title: Buy ASTA-POOL: Can humans beat bots?

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS: 10
  • Memory: 4 GB RAM
  • Storage: 1 GB available space
pc_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system

short_description: Everybody loves playing pool, especially if it's in outer-space against robots! Asta-Pool is the perfect casual game for humans who have never played AND for those whose friends call them 'shark'. Play old favorites, discover new ones, and help J.J. prove that humans can still beat bots!
